paper.title: An Uncertainty Thermometer to Measure the Macroeconomic-Financial Risk in South American Countries
paper.abstract: This paper aims to develop an uncertainty thermometer to identify and measure the macro-social-financial risk of 10 SA countries from 1978 to 2014. This thermometer is based on the early warning models to facilitate systemic risk monitoring. Contrary to other studies, we build a macroeconomic-social-financial vulnerability index composed of macroeconomic, social development, liquidity, solvency and market vulnerability sub-indicators through the partial least squares structural equation model. We identify high (unmanageable, intolerable and unstable) and low (manageable, moderate, stable and strong) risk levels using machine learning methods. Our results are robust and consistent, because the macroeconomic-social-financial index captures periods of high uncertainty presented in the region. (c) 2020 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是开发一个宏观经济-金融风险的不确定性温度计，用于识别和测量系统性风险，并通过机器学习方法进行风险等级分类。这直接属于金融风险管理的范畴，特别是系统性风险的监测和评估。
